title: 3209 trackpad
message:
The mouse is really laggy/glitchy. you move it at it appears in a new spot, does not glide if that makes sense. works fine with usb mouse. i've replaced bottom case (keyboard, trackpad and flex cable) and still has same issue. smc reset and pram reset did not solve either.

the computer initially came in with does not power on. i did an smc reset and that fixed it, but now mouse issues. no liquid or physical damage.

title: 3209 trackpad
message:
Post exact voltage for J5700, pins 1, 10, 13.
Also check solders and resistors around U5700.

title: 3209 trackpad
message:
Check connections from MLB to trackpad cicuitry.
This will discard bad contacts on the IPD connector...

title: 3209 trackpad
message:
1- 3.06
10-5.095
13-3.422  (this was the pp3v42 line)

tested on the trackpad itself

title: 3209 trackpad
message:
Check all connections between the MLB and trackpad board.
Continuity, on buzzer mode, or ohm scale.

title: 3209 trackpad
message: all point have continuity .  ive replaced the trackpad and flex as well. was the first thing i did.

title: 3209 trackpad
message:
Did you try other battery?
How it works without battery, on charger only?

Also try your USB test OSX; disconnect internal SSD.

title: 3209 trackpad
message: was testing without battery, charger only.  haven't tried external osx

title: 3209 trackpad
message: Still the same issue with known good battery connected?

title: 3209 trackpad
message:
tried with new battery and fresh os on external drive. same issue.

Pin - MLB - Trackpad

1 - 3.31 - 3.29
2- 3.29 - 3.27
3 - 0 - 0
4- 0 - 0
5- 3.09 - 3.1
6- 0 - 0
7- 0 - 0
8- 3.29 - 3.28
9- 3.29 - 3.28
10- 5.09 - 5.09
11- 3.42 - 3.42
12- 3.42 - 3.42
13- 3.42 - 3.42
14- 3.42 - 3.42



saw pin 6 is 0, so i changed u5700 and same issue.  still 0v

title: 3209 trackpad
message:
Pin 6 is OK with 0V, as it is D- line of an USB.

Does the keyboard work correctly?

title: 3209 trackpad
message: Run corresponding EFI ASD and see if any error pops out.
